trait.name: Wrath Beyond Death
entries: If the Flameskull is destroyed, while it still has a third level spell slot, the Flameskull immediately casts fireball as a reaction, centered on itself. If no third level spell slot is available, the Flameskull casts magic missile upcast at either 1st or 2nd level.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flameskull uses Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

Blazing green flames and mad, echoing laughter follow a disembodied skull as it patrols its demesne. When the undead flameskull discovers trespassers, it blasts the intruders with fiery rays from its eyes and dreadful spells called up from the dark recesses of its memory.
Dark spellcasters fashion flameskulls from the remains of dead wizards. When the ritual is complete, green flames erupt from the skull to complete its ghastly transformation.

entries.name: Legacy of Life
entries: A flameskull only dimly recalls its former life. Though it might speak in its old voice and recount key events from its past, it is but an echo of its former self. However, its undead transformation grants it full access to the magic it wielded in life, letting it cast spells while ignoring the material and somatic components it can no longer employ.

entries.name: Eternally Bound
entries: Intelligent and vigilant, a flameskull serves its creator by protecting a hidden treasure hoard, a secret chamber, or a specific individual. A flameskull carries out the directives given to it when it was created, and it interprets those commands to the letter. A flameskull's master must craft its instructions with care to ensure that the creature carries out its tasks properly.

entries.name: Wreathed in Flame
entries: The fire wreathing a flameskull burns continually, giving off bright light that the creature controls. It uses those flames as a weapon, focusing them to loose them as fiery rays from its eye sockets.

entries.name: Eldritch Rejuvenation
entries: A flameskull's shattered fragments reform unless they are splashed with holy water or subjected to a {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell. If it can no longer fulfill its intended purpose, the re-formed flameskull is beholden to no one and becomes autonomous.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A flameskull doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep

walk.condition: (40 ft. in hybrid form, 50 ft. in dire wolf form)

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The werewolf regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the werewolf takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werewolf's next turn. The werewolf dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The werewolf makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

action.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The werewolf polymorphs into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire wolf, or back into its true form, which appears humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

legendary.name: Swipe
entries: The werewolf makes one Claws attack.

legendary.name: Mauling Pounce (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The werewolf moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and it can make one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) against each creature it moves past.

legendary.name: Ravenous Hunger (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The werewolf changes into hybrid or dire wolf form and then makes one Bite attack.

Loup garou possess a strain of lycanthropy more virulent than that carried by common werewolves. Aside from being deadlier than their werewolf cousins, loup garou aggressively spread the plague of lycanthropy. Only through the death of a loup garou might those afflicted by it escape their curse.

entries.name: Loup Garou Lycanthropy
entries: A Humanoid who succumbs to a loup garou's lycanthropy becomes a werewolf. This form of lycanthropy can't be removed while the loup garou that inflicted the curse lives. See the {@i Monster Manual} for details on lycanthropy.

Once a loup garou is slain, a {@spell remove curse} spell cast during the night of a full moon on any afflicted werewolf it created forces the target to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a success, the curse is broken, and the target returns to its normal form and gains 3 levels of exhaustion. On a failure, the curse remains, and the target automatically fails any saving throw made to break this curse for 1 month.

monster.name: Anastrasya Karelova (Enhanced Threat)
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Anastrasya regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Anastrasya takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Anastrasya can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: Anastrasya has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} Anastrasya can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} Anastrasya takes 20 acid damage when she ends her turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} Anastrasya is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into her heart while she is {@condition incapacitated} in her resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} Anastrasya takes 20 radiant damage when she starts her turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Shapechanger (Vampire)
entries: If Anastrasya isn't in sunlight or running water, she can use her action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into her true form. While in bat form, Anastrasya can't speak, her walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Her statistics, other than her size and speed, are unchanged. Anything she is wearing transforms with her, but nothing she is carrying does. She reverts to her true form if she dies. While in mist form, Anastrasya can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. She is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. She has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and she is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage she takes from sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Anastrasya makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by Anastrasya, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and Anastrasya regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Anastrasya can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

monster.name: Strahd Zombie (Enchanced Threat)
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries: Whenever the zombie takes at least 5 bludgeoning or slashing damage at one time, roll a {@dice d20} to determine what else happens to it:
1–8: One leg is severed from the zombie if it has any legs left.
9–16: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any arms left.
17–20: The zombie is decapitated.

If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points, all parts of it die. Until then, a severed part acts on the zombie's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 8. Any damage it takes is subtracted from the zombie's hit points.
A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.
A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll. Each time the zombie loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.

If its head is severed, the zombie loses its bite attack and its body is {@condition blinded} unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet. It can make a bite attack, but only against a target in its space.

The zombie's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0 feet, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.
Strahd zombies are undead that serve the vampire Strahd von Zarovich. Created from the long-dead guards of Castle Ravenloft, they were called into being through dark magic by Strahd himself.

entries.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries: A Strahd zombie's gray-green flesh looks soft, and its bones seem brittle. Any good hit from a bludgeoning or slashing weapon severs part of the zombie's body. Strahd zombies are suffused with horrible necromantic magic that allows their severed body parts to continue to attack. All parts of a Strahd zombie are considered one and the same creature, so damage to any part damages the whole creature.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A Strahd zombie doesn't require air or sleep.

The revenant reclaims its mortal body and superficially resembles a zombie. However, instead of lifeless eyes, a revenant's eyes burn with resolve and flare in the presence of its adversary. If the revenant's original body was destroyed or is otherwise unavailable, the spirit of the revenant enters another humanoid corpse. entries.name: Hunger for Revenge

If its foe is too powerful for the revenant to destroy on its own, it seeks worthy allies to help it fulfill its quest.

entries.name: Divine Justice
entries: No magic can hide a creature pursued by a revenant, which always knows the direction and distance between it and the target of its vengeance. If the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul flies forth to seek out a new corpse in which to resume its hunt.

item.name: Broad Collar of Perfect Control
entries: {@i This collar consists of two tarnished brass metal half-circles connected via brass chains. The front piece contains a polished black gem. When observed, an occasional flash of green lightning can be spotted inside the gem.}
While attuned to this item, any undead created via {@spell Animate Dead} gain the following trait:
{@b {@i Turn Immunity.}} The creature is immune to effects that turn undead.

item.name: Gnawing Boots
entries: {@i These brown leather boots don't bark, but they can bite. If the boots are equipped by an unaware victim, the boots bite whoever puts them on, unless the command word is spoken. If worn with the proper command word, the teeth will not bite inwards towards the wearer but outwards, providing unparalleled grip.}

The boots provide advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to avoid being shoved or knocked prone. As an action, you can use these boots to walk up vertical surfaces for 1 hour, as if you had cast the {@spell Spider Climb} spell with no components and requiring no concentration. This property of the boots can't be used again until the next dawn.

{@b {@i Curse.}} If a person attunes to the boots without saying the proper command word, the boots will inflict {@damage 1d6} piercing damage when put on, and a {@dc 13} Strength check is required to remove them. An {@spell Identify} spell reveals the command word.

item.name: Lens of Identification
entries: {@i This is a brass-rimmed pane of violet crystal.}
While looking through the lens, you have advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to reveal information about a creature or object you can see.

In addition, you can cast the {@spell Identify} spell once per day without sacrificing a spell slot using the lens, using no other component. Once you do so, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Longsword of Vengeance (Rusted)
entries: {@i This ancient sword is covered in a thick layer of rust and decay, it deals bludgeoning damage instead of slashing damage. The pommel of the handle has a silver scale built into it. When holding this sword, you feel a sense of simmering anger.}
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@b {@i Curse.}} The sword remembers its proper owner. This weapon will betray a wielder who attempts to use it against its original owner. The blade seeks to be reunited with its owner as a matter of honor.

item.name: Hand of the Fiend (Smoldering)
entries: {@i This hellish appendage has barbed spines, elongated fingers, and long nails. The skin is bright red, which extends to the elbow. The hand radiates heat even when its fire abilities are not in use, when examined long enough the hand occasionally spasms and emits a wisp of smoke or a spark.}

While the Hand is attached to your body, you are considered proficient with melee and spell attacks using it. If you cannot normally cast spells, use your charisma modifier. The Hand is considered your pact weapon, and benefits from any improvements to your pact weapon, including overcoming resistances or making multiple attacks with one action. Additionally, your unarmed strikes inflict 1d8 bludgeoning damage.
The Hand has 6 charges, it regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at midnight.

{@b {@i Fueled by Fire. (1-2 charges)}} Melee attacks with the Hand are powered by the flames of Hell. When you use your action to make a melee attack with the Hand of the Fiend, you may use your bonus action to spend 1 charge, inflicting an additional 1d8 fire damage on the attack. If you can make two melee attacks with the Hand of the Fiend, you can spend an additional charge to add 1d8 fire damage to the second attack.

{@b {@i Cloaked in Smoke. (2 charges)}} As an action, you may expend two charges to cast the spell {@spell Invisibility} without using any other material components or spell slots. This does require concentration.

{@b {@i Hurl Flame. (2 charges)}} As an action, you snap your fingers and produce an orb of fire in the palm of the hand. You may make a ranged spell attack, range 60 ft., one target. On a hit, the orb inflicts {@damage 3d6} fire damage to the target. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it catches fire.

item.name: Ritual Dagger
entries: {@i A dark iron dagger with its handle wrapped in gravecloth, the blade is ornately carved with arcane symbols. When the blade is drawn upon one's own flesh, the symbols alight with a ravenous light, and the dagger is empowered with blood magic for its next strike.}
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

{@b {@i Ravening Iron.}} As a bonus action when making an attack using this dagger, you may expend your own hit dice to inflict an additional 1d6 necrotic damage through the attack. Up to 3 hit dice can be spent this way per attack, for a maximum {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage.
{@b {@i Curse.}} After ten hit dice have been spent using the Ravening Iron ability, the dagger entraps the soul of the next creature it cuts.

If the next person the Ritual Dagger cuts is anyone not attuned to the dagger, the dagger becomes sentient and will resist being used. The attuner will need to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw when using its Ravening Iron ability to avoid cutting too deeply and dealing the necrotic damage to themself instead of their enemy.

If the next person the Ritual Dagger cuts is the person attuned to the dagger, their soul becomes bound to the dagger, and they cannot unattune to the dagger. If the attuner is separated from the dagger, they will die within 60  seconds, although they may still communicate telepathically with a person who holds the dagger. A {@spell Greater Restoration} spell or equivalent powerful spell can undo this curse. A {@spell Raise Dead} spell or similar resurrection magic targeting the attuner will fail unless the body and the dagger containing the soul are in contact with one another when the spell is cast.

item.name: Heartseeker
entries: {@i A steel rapier with an ornate handguard, into which is carved the name of the sword: Heartseeker. The Baron named the rapier after its uncanny ability to find vital organs when striking. The pommel is carved and painted with the Vallakovich coat of arms: a black rampant (standing) bear on a red field. The blade has been well-kept, and there are seven notches carefully filed at the base, whether to rip flesh when pulled from a body or mark past victories, none but the Baron could say.}
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you roll a 20 with this magic weapon, the target takes an extra 7 piercing damage, in addition to the critical damage.

item.name: Sword Cane
entries: {@i A wooden cane with a polished silver handle, molded into the shape of a hawk's head. The left eye of the hawk has been replaced with a polished bead of pure black jet. When the bead is pressed inwards, the wooden casing of the cane is released and the silvered blade of the sword is revealed. Hidden by the case, on each side of the blade are carved names: Ingrid and Erasmus.}
{@b {@i Special.}} When you make a melee attack with the Sword Cane, you may choose to deal bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage.

item.name: The Mirror Blade
entries: {@i This blade is formed from the shattered pieces of a mirror, perhaps manifested by Strahd's self-loathing in a moment of furious anger. The blade floats freely close to its wielder's hand, and seems to obey their will faster than movement of their arm. At the behest of its master the blade can split apart and form a broken mirror that floats in the air, or instead create a dangerous field or glass shards to slice the flesh of anything that passes through.}
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
The Mirror Blade has 6 charges, it regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at midnight.

{@b {@i Shattered Glass. (1 charge)}} As an action, you may expend one charge to cast the spell {@spell Cloud of Daggers} without using any other material components or spell slots. This does not require concentration, but the sword cannot be used for melee attacks or A Dream of Mirrors while the spell is active.

{@b {@i Dream of Mirrors. (3 charges)}} As an action, you may expend three charges to cast the spell {@spell Scrying} without using any other material components or spell slots. This does not require concentration, but the sword cannot be used for melee attacks or Shattered Glass while the spell is active.

item.name: Izek's Battleaxe
entries: {@i A cruel double-headed axe, its blades are pitted with small holes and imperfections. The handle is made of a blackened wood that has been oiled, but has become stained near the head a darker shade. When held, the blade exudes a simmering rage.}
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, while you are attuned to this weapon, your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained.

{@b {@i Curse.}} This axe is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the axe, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one, unless no foe is within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear.

Whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll using this weapon, roll a new attack targeting an ally within five feet of you. If the result is a hit, they take damage as if you had attacked them.
